medical_history.chief_complaint: Central abdominal pain after starting to eat solid foods.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 5 days prior to admission, following a meal containing hummus. The pain has been constant with varying intensity, not relieved by any measures. Associated symptoms include nausea, with no vomiting, no bowel movement for over a week, and no fever or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity; history of laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy one month prior.
